intro: Fimbristylis prabatensis, commonly known as the Prabat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions like Thailand and Malaysia. This perennial herb typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
